title: What Script font?
content:
Does anyone know what font this is?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Scripttype.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131106074524/http:/typophile.com/files/Scripttype.jpg) | 53.29 KB |
author: AnalogSystm

comments.content:
There's something very familiar about this script, I just don't know what (and it's not Coca-Cola).

I tried looking in Veer, MyFonts and FontShop, but couldn't find anything that would match. Could be custom, but I doubt it's a freeware font.

_There’s something very familiar about this script, I just don’t know what_

I thought the same thing. My first guess was Fontmesa, but that didn't pan out. Nor did Letterhead. I'll be interested to see what it is.

It bears a superficial resemblance to [Mandate](http://web.archive.org/) (Freehand 521), but I don't recognize it either. This will be a good Script Guide addition, if someone knows it.

- Mike Yanega

It also looks a lot like the sort of thing Jason Walcott (Jukebox at Veer.com) would do, or possibly Patrick Griffin of Canada Type. Both of them like to revive old pre-digital styles.

- Mike Yanega
Closest I can think of is Spills from comicbookfonts.com, but it's not a match.
